channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.description:

  • Description: On 05/10/2024 shipment was discovered during the shipment inspection process to contain hidden dangerous goods at the DHL STP service station, 1940 Cargo Road, Minneapolis, MN 55450 Transportation by road has been confirmed. '

item.title: Report E-2024050370
item.description:
Report E-2024050370

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-22T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: FRIDLEY
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Methanol (UN1230) released from a metal tote for unknown reasons. The terminal is unable to see any damage and the release was contained to the trailer floor and had mostly evaporated. The terminal reviewed the BoL and SDS and advised the caller that according to the BoL, the tank is reported as being product RESIDUE with a net weight of 1 pound. The terminal used PPE provided to wipe the spill with absorbents and they were placed it into an 8 gallon metal drum for disposal. The waste was left for the terminal to manage.
